definition: in the capacity of/as
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
lit. teacher for one day, father for ever (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 ri4 wei2 shi1 , zhong1 shen1 wei2 fu4

sentences.english: Waterproof jacket that transforms into a one person sleeping bag.
sentences.chinese: 这是一件防水夹克，可以变身为单人睡袋哦。

sentences.english: Promoting literacy is one of Laura Bush's main projects as first lady.
sentences.chinese: 推广读写能力是萝拉身为第一夫人的主要计画。

sentences.english: I have long prided myself on being a good teacher.
sentences.chinese: 我一向以身为一名好老师而自豪。

sentences.english: They both bewailed their misfortune at being young, unmarried returned students.
sentences.chinese: 两人慨叹不幸身为青年未婚留学生的麻烦。

sentences.english: As a coach, you need great patience.
sentences.chinese: 身为教练，你要有极大的耐心。

sentences.english: As for being adopted, I have no desire to find my real parents.
sentences.chinese: 身为养女，我并不想找到自己的生身父母。

sentences.english: Just a rookie lawyer, Wright as he solves a variety of puzzling cases.
sentences.chinese: 身为新人律师，成步堂解决了众多谜题般的案件。

sentences.english: It would seem that Wizarding folk aren't injured as quickly by things like this.
sentences.chinese: 大概身为巫师，这些寻常的事故不会造成伤害。

sentences.english: Mr. Oddsson, a lawyer, doesn't have that credential.
sentences.chinese: 而身为律师的奥德松不符合这项要求。

sentences.english: Some are lovers. Blind to the consequences of their actions.
sentences.chinese: 有些身为情人，无视她们的行为后果。

sentences.english: Although you are identical twins, what are your differences?
sentences.chinese: 身为同卵双生儿，你们有什么差别？

sentences.english: With girl change as handsome, toward become idols march.
sentences.chinese: 以少女变身为帅男，朝成为偶像进军。

sentences.english: As the star of a circus, Boog has lived a luxurious life.
sentences.chinese: 身为马戏团的大明星，布榖过着十分奢华的生活。

sentences.english: Makgatho, a lawyer, had been receiving treatment for several months.
sentences.chinese: 身为律师的马克贾托已接受了几个月的治疗。

sentences.english: As a student, you need to study hard.
sentences.chinese: 你身为一位学生，必须用功读书。

sentences.english: A Beijing native, Ulrich earned an Ivy-studded education in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 身为北京人的李晶在美国常春藤名校接受过高等教育。

definition: to act as/used erroneously for 作為|作为
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
to be born of/to come from/family background/class origin
identity/status/capacity/dignity/position/rank
to know well/to be fully aware of
holding two jobs simultaneously
to take upon oneself/to assume
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to consider oneself as/to believe oneself to be
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
title/rank/appellation
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
this (person)
